name: Mine
description: A well-crafted pick leans against a wall at the entrance to a mine. The Mine card represents something valuable underground or buried in the earth.

person.reverse: Someone who places things in the earth, such as a gardener or an undertaker.

creatureTrap.upright: A creature that burrows underground, especially one that delves into the earth in search of prey (such as a giant weasel).
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature that lives underground but hunts above ground (such as an ankheg or a bulette).

place.upright: A mine, an archaeological dig, or a similar excavated site.
place.reverse: A place that has sunk into the earth, perhaps swallowed in a sinkhole or covered in a mudslide.

treasure.upright: A treasure from the earth, such as metal ore or gems, or any treasure that has been buried and unearthed.
treasure.reverse: A treasure buried in the earth.

situation.upright: Something unearthed that should have remained buried.
